This is a « brain friendly » guide based on screen-shots to help you set up encrypted email communication. It takes between 25 and 45 minutes to complete. Access Helpline's staff is at your service if you run into any problem.

Cryptocat is an add-on for Google chrome and FireFox. This tutorial help you to install it on both of them. Depend on your prefered browser choose the match instructions.

_This guide is based on Free and Open Source Software. Through the process we will guide you on the installation and configuration of CryptoCat

About Access

Access defends and extends the digital rights of users at risk around the world. By combining innovative policy, user engagement, and direct technical support, we fight for open and secure communications for all.

For More Information please visit https://accessnow.org

1.Download and Install

1.1.On Google Chrome

1.Download Cryptocat from the link.

2.Click on Free blue Button on the Top right of the window.

3.A new window will be opened with the title “Confirm New App”. Please hit “Add” button.

1.2. On Firefox

1.Go to this link on your browser.It will lead into the installation page.

2.Click on the icon with a red cat button Add to Firefox and allow the installation by clicking on Allow button that will appear.

3.After that you will be asking to confirm the installation. Click on Install Now.

4.Then you have to restart the Browser.

5.The browser is restarted.

6.An icon with a red cat should appear in the Menu Bar on the Top lef of you windows. If not please follow the next step(7) but if if so continue to the step(8).

7.a. To show the Cryptocat icon. Hit the option menu button (buton with 3 bars) on the right of the browser as shown on the picture bellow. Then click on Customize button.

7.b. A set of icons should appear on the left of your windows. Find the CryptoCat Icon And drag it into the Menu Bar.

8.Click on the icon. An interface in new tab should be displayed.

2.Using Cryptocat

There is two ways to use Cryptocat.

2.1.Launch Cryptocat

2.1.1. First method

  1. Open a new tab and click on Apps icon in the top left of the new tab.

  2. A Cryptocat icon going to be shown. Click on it to launch the application.

If you successfully launched Cryptocat please ignore the second and third method.

2.1.2.Second method

  1. Copy the following address in your browser address bar : chrome://apps/

  2. A Cryptocat Icon going to be shown. Click on it to launch the application.

2.1.3.Third method

  1. Go back to the first installation link

  2. Click on the top right green button Launch the App.

2.2. Create a secure chat conversation

  1. In the Cryptocat interface, you need to fill in two fields:
  • Conversation name: you can choose a name suites you. Example testwithmyfriend as a room conversion.
  • Nickname: choose any nickname you find it appropriate. Example peter an a nickname.
  • Hit Connect button.
  1. To invite your friends to your conversation room testwithmyfriend you already created. They need to:
  • Install Cryptocat.
  • Launch it.
  • Add testwithmyfriend in the conversion name to joining your room conversion.
  • Add any pseudo name. For example Tim.
  • Hit Connect button.

Note: more then one person can join a conversion room.

If you have any doubt about the identity of the person you are talking with. You need to follow the steps below which we really recommend it to do.

TO be sure that you are talking with the right person:

  1. On the top right, click in the the littel down arrow beside your friend Tim nickname.

  2. A new screen will be opened. You find on the top of this screen the authentication status between you and Tim. For the first time it is not yet authenticated.(you are talking we not verified person)

To do so, you need to create a secret question and secret answer and hit ask button.

  1. Your friend will receive this question then answer it(sure you should share with him your response but with a secure why).

  2. If he have saccessfully answer to you question, the authentification status will be changed to OK(person is verified).

Note: you should do this process every time you open a new chat conversation.
